topic.title: Now Available: Foreign Relations of the United States, 1977–1980, Volume XVI, Southern Africa
topic.body: This volume documents the efforts of the Jimmy Carter administration to promote peace and stability in the Southern Africa region. The focus of this volume is on U.S. policy toward Angola, Namibia, Rhodesia, and South Africa.
topic.image-description: Book cover of Foreign Relations of the United States, 1977–1980, Volume XVI, Southern Africa
topic.image-source-information: Created by the Office of the Historian
